scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Your colleague, Mark, messages: 'Hey Alex, I really need your help with this urgent task. Can you help me out?' You responded, 'Mark, I'm currently on leave. Can you ask someone else, or can it wait until I return?' Mark replies, 'I understand you're off, but there's really no one else who can handle this as well as you. It's quite critical.' You replied, 'I understand the urgency. I'll help this time, but please ensure there’s a backup plan for such situations in the future.' Mark persists, 'I understand you need your time off, but this really can't wait. It’s a critical issue and could affect the whole project if not resolved immediately.'
scenes.description: Mark hesitates, 'I really appreciate you taking this on, but we need to ensure this doesn't happen again.' Monica and Bob join the conversation.

options.text: I'm happy to help for now, but we should discuss long-term solutions once I'm back.
options.analysis: You showed understanding and empathy, but your self-regulation could be improved as you agreed to work during your leave.

options.text: Mark, I really think someone else needs to step up for this one. It’s important for the team to handle such issues in my absence.
options.analysis: You maintained good self-regulation by setting firm boundaries, but showed less empathy and motivation towards the urgent task.

options.text: I understand the urgency. I'll help this time, but please ensure there’s a backup plan for such situations in the future.
options.analysis: You balanced empathy and self-regulation well, and communicated your availability clearly, showing good social skills.
